str2: For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.
From diatithemai; properly, a disposition, i.e. a contract.
Firm, steadfast, enduring, sure, certain. From the base of basis; stable.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Middle - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: (a) I appoint, make (of a covenant), (b) I make (a will). Middle voice from dia and tithemi; to put apart, i.e. dispose.
(a) adj: dead, lifeless, subject to death, mortal, (b) noun: a dead body, a corpse. From an apparently primary nekus; dead.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To have strength, be strong, be in full health and vigor, be able; meton: I prevail. From ischus; to have force.
When, at which time. From hos and te; at which too, i.e. When.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To live, be alive. A primary verb; to live.
